name: E. Similar Polynomials
statement:
A polynomial A(x) of degree d is an expression of the form A(x) = a_0 +
a_1 x + a_2 x^2 +
dots + a_d x^d, where a_i are integers, and a_d
neq 0. Two polynomials A(x) and B(x) are called similar if there is an
integer s such that for any integer x it holds that B(x)
equiv A(x+s)
pmod{10^9+7}. For two similar polynomials A(x) and B(x) of degree d,
you’re given their values in the points x=0,1,
dots, d modulo 10^9+7.Find a value s such that B(x)
equiv A(x+s)
pmod{10^9+7} for all integers x.
